title: Bug 6322 All types dialog shows obfuscated classes
description: Bug 6322 All types dialog shows obfuscated classes. JDK 1.4 includes obfuscated classes (a, a1, b, c, d) etc.
OB: The All types dialog shows obfuscated classes in a prominent manner. These classes appear alongside the normal classes and are not differentiated in any way.
EB: Obfuscated classes should be less prominent in the All types dialog. They should be visually differentiated from normal classes, making it easier for users to identify and distinguish them.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Launch the application.
2. Open the All types dialog.
3. Observe that obfuscated classes are displayed alongside the normal classes without any visual distinction.
